revised_title: Relaxation Methods for Engineering Problems: Plane-Potential Problems with Specified Normal Gradients
tldr: The authors present two methods for solving plane-potential problems involving specified normal gradients in engineering. They discuss the relaxation techniques and their applications, focusing on the physical interpretation of the problem using Prandtl's membrane analogy. The methods are applicable to various types of boundary conditions and can be used to find optimal solutions for engineering problems.
